subject: p13352405
History: -year-old man status post VATS and decortication, now with removal of right-sided chest tube. Assess for pneumothorax.
Findings: Comparison is made to the previous study from. There is a very tiny right apical pneumothorax following removal of the right-sided chest tube. There is persistent elevation of the right hemidiaphragm with atelectasis at the right lung base and a right-sided pleural effusion. A rounded opacity is seen in the right suprahilar region and is stable. The left lung is relatively clear aside from atelectasis at the left lung base and a small left-sided pleural effusion.
